subject: Re: [junit] Re: NEW Object instance
msgSnippet: ... If all they do is that, then I wouldn t bother.  This will be tested implicitly within every other testcases that use the class. Besides, we d then need
messageBody:
whitworthjanet wrote:
> Since the constructor takes two parameters, it must do something
> with them. I would test that it actually does what it should with
> them. If it sets member variables, were they set, etc.
>
>

If all they do is that, then I wouldn't bother. This will be tested
implicitly within every other testcases that use the class.

Besides, we'd then need someway to check they were set, creating
getters, etc., which we probably wouldn't need.

If the Responsibility of the Constructor was to validate the values, by
throwing an exception say, then I'd write an explicit test for that.
